intro: Hysterionica jasionoides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, making it an important plant for supporting local pollinator populations.
